meanings.definition: A track or tracks on which a train is parked or unloaded.
meanings.sent1: The train slowly moved along the sidings to make space for other trains.
meanings.sent2: The sidings at the station were filled with cargo waiting to be transported.
meanings.sent3: The sidings were so busy that the trains had to wait in line like cars at a drive-thru.
meanings.sent4: The sidings resembled a row of patient giants, holding the weight of the train cars.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the sidings cast long shadows across the railway yard.

meanings.definition: The act of providing siding for a building.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers focused on the sidings to protect the building from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The sidings of the house were painted a bright blue color.
meanings.sent3: The sidings of the building whispered secrets to each other in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like fresh paint on the sidings, brightening up the whole street.
meanings.sent5: The sidings of the house stood strong against the storm, shielding the interior from harm.
